oneOf.title: MongoDB Atlas Replica Set
oneOf.description: MongoDB Atlas-hosted cluster configured as a replica set

connection_string.title: Connection String
connection_string.description: The connection string of the cluster that you want to replicate.

database.title: Database Name
database.description: The name of the MongoDB database that contains the collection(s) to replicate.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username which is used to access the database.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password associated with this username.

auth_source.title: Authentication Source
auth_source.description: The authentication source where the user information is stored.  See https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/connection-string/#mongodb-urioption-urioption.authSource for more details.

schema_enforced.title: Schema Enforced
schema_enforced.description: When enabled, syncs will validate and structure records against the stream's schema.

connection_string.title: Connection String
connection_string.description: The connection string of the cluster that you want to replicate.  https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/connection-string/#find-your-self-hosted-deployment-s-connection-string for more information.

database.title: Database Name
database.description: The name of the MongoDB database that contains the collection(s) to replicate.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username which is used to access the database.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password associated with this username.

auth_source.title: Authentication Source
auth_source.description: The authentication source where the user information is stored.

schema_enforced.title: Schema Enforced
schema_enforced.description: When enabled, syncs will validate and structure records against the stream's schema.

initial_waiting_seconds.title: Initial Waiting Time in Seconds (Advanced)
initial_waiting_seconds.description: The amount of time the connector will wait when it launches to determine if there is new data to sync or not. Defaults to 300 seconds. Valid range: 120 seconds to 1200 seconds.

queue_size.title: Size of the queue (Advanced)
queue_size.description: The size of the internal queue. This may interfere with memory consumption and efficiency of the connector, please be careful.

discover_sample_size.title: Document discovery sample size (Advanced)
discover_sample_size.description: The maximum number of documents to sample when attempting to discover the unique fields for a collection.

invalid_cdc_cursor_position_behavior.title: Invalid CDC position behavior (Advanced)
invalid_cdc_cursor_position_behavior.description: Determines whether Airbyte should fail or re-sync data in case of an stale/invalid cursor value into the WAL. If 'Fail sync' is chosen, a user will have to manually reset the connection before being able to continue syncing data. If 'Re-sync data' is chosen, Airbyte will automatically trigger a refresh but could lead to higher cloud costs and data loss.

update_capture_mode.title: Capture mode (Advanced)
update_capture_mode.description: Determines how Airbyte looks up the value of an updated document. If 'Lookup' is chosen, the current value of the document will be read. If 'Post Image' is chosen, then the version of the document immediately after an update will be read. WARNING : Severe data loss will occur if this option is chosen and the appropriate settings are not set on your Mongo instance : https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/changeStreams/#change-streams-with-document-pre-and-post-images.

initial_load_timeout_hours.title: Initial Load Timeout in Hours (Advanced)
initial_load_timeout_hours.description: The amount of time an initial load is allowed to continue for before catching up on CDC logs.
